column4: so how many people in here get paid to sit in here and help out us newbies?
nobody
everyone is a volunteer
thats real nice
find: paths must precede expression: apps
/apps/metacity/general/theme
the debs are in /var/cache/apt/archives you can copy them out and use them on other rigs, or you can use aptoncd to make a handy cd of them
iim almost positive ive downloaded way more than whats in the folder...
thats what apt-get / software centre use to store them
if you run: sudo apt-get clean    it will, or if you run: sudo apt-get autoclean   they will not be stored
do you know what the different "vga=ox***" number mean?
http://wiki.archlinux.org/index.php/Gensplash  75% of the way down, found it with bing.
do you know what the 1920x1200x64 would be?

i use this: http://idyllictux.wordpress.com/2010/04/26/lucidubuntu-10-04-high-resolution-plymouth-virtual-terminal-for-atinvidia-cards-with-proprietaryrestricted-driver/    you can just set the res you like uses the fb driver
when i run the livecd it shows at its full res, and doesnt include the vga=0x*** line, should i remove it from the installed grub line to get full res?

not sure then, you'll need to take some action though to get it rocking. I use that guide to make mine run at a decent res and on nvidia based rigs (most of mine are) I have to use it or I get no boot splash
there is no x32 afaik, 32bit in windows is 24 in linux
just add it as a boot option in /etc/default/grub   you'll need the extra packages defined in that guide

I did that in the file but it still doesnt show at 1920x1200, think it maxes at 1600x1200, but i also have already installed and uninstalled startupmanager that had a gui for setting to 1600x1200, so i think that think is overriding the res setting
then I am unsure, did you install the extra packages the guide advises?
what guide again?
http://idyllictux.wordpress.com/2010/04/26/lucidubuntu-10-04-high-resolution-plymouth-virtual-terminal-for-atinvidia-cards-with-proprietaryrestricted-driver/
yes i have followed that TUT, but like i said i think startupmanager files are overriding somewhere in the system...
do you know the progress of the theming for grub2?
the files for grub will be used to determine grub's resolution
last i heard it was still in development?
do you know the progress of the theming for grub2?
last i heard it was still in development?
http://linux.aldeby.org/configure-grub2-options-and-background.html
hardly worth it imho, the screen is only displayed for about 3 seconds
good point but its more about the eyecandy, not staring at the same lame screen all the time, a nice GUI makes everything better lmao
your call
i guess if you have nothing better to tweak
do you know of the project or where downloads are located for the themes of grub2?
no idea, grub doesn't interest me as I single boot systems so I never have to see it
good point, i havent weened myself off of win7 yet lol
burg?
is that the theme name?
or project name?
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=v_BAyAclZ9g
its GRUB backwards, it's an alternate (and unofficial) boot loader
ah, i was speaking of the actual themes for grub2, one sec i get a link
http://paste.ubuntu.com/501370/ <--- this is the contents of my grub.cfg
look about right?
whats VBE?
no, you havent read the page, You need this sort of thing in the grub file too: GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX_DEFAULT="quiet splash nomodeset video=uvesafb:mode_option=1366x768-24,mtrr=3,scroll=ywrap"
change the res to what you desire
if you only read parts of guids, it WONT work
hahaha i rly truly am sry i read right over that bit
brb going to test
did you run: sudo apt-get install v86d hwinfo
you on still?
sup?
alright this is what i have for you one sec
http://paste.ubuntu.com/501414/
thats my original
here's mine, I read the whole document: http://pastebin.com/dqYWQnsd
http://paste.ubuntu.com/501415/
thats the edited one
looks good
cool. update grub and update initramfs and you are done
i ran hwinfo and cant find anything about a video card...
i had to run it with | less
TY
I just use the default, works fine
seems the xpad module drives it
huh?
if you modprobe xpad it will work
you'll need an xbox to usb adapter
i have a wired controller, will that do?
sure, grab an xbox to usb converter if it already isn't usb and you should be ok
so "sudo modprobe xpad" ???
yeah should do it. You can add it in /etc/modules if it flys
you may need jscalibrator to make it nice
is there a config file for xpad?
it should obey whatever config there is for jscalibrator
wheres jscal......
you'll need to install it. Try running it in terminal, you'll be shown some suggested packages
couldnt find it in synaptic, means it wont show if i run "sudo apt-get install" either right?
http://packages.ubuntu.com/dapper/jscalibrator
i found this, it shows its for drapper tho???
there will be a joystick app some place
ok lol i found one
yep, mv will move directories too
mv folder /path/to/destination
ls -la file
